theory: Dragon was a former Marine who grew disillusioned with the Navy and World Government, leading him to form the Revolutionary Army. This would explain why Garp trained both his son and grandson so harshly, hoping to keep them in the Marines.

The 'Will of D.' connects all D. bearers across different families (Monkey, Gol, Portgas) as descendants of an ancient kingdom that opposed the World Government. Garp, Dragon, and Luffy all bear the D., but chose different paths to challenge or uphold the current world order.

Dragon has a wind or weather-based Devil Fruit power, evidenced by the mysterious wind that saved Luffy in Loguetown. The episode's flashback to that moment hints at Dragon's ability to control or summon wind.

Garp's 'Fist of Love' is actually an early demonstration of advanced Armament Haki, despite Oda's humorous explanation that it's powered by 'love.' The fact that it can hurt Luffy suggests advanced combat techniques beyond normal physics.

The Monkey family represents three different approaches to justice: Garp (lawful justice through Marines), Dragon (revolutionary justice against corruption), and Luffy (personal justice and freedom). This generational shift shows the evolution of the D. clan's opposition to tyranny.

Dragon deliberately stayed away from Luffy to protect him from the World Government's attention. Being known as the son of the world's most wanted criminal would have put a target on Luffy from birth.
